sent.subject: Fwd: Fw: Kids: Gottta love them!!!
sent.body: --- Original Messsage ---   Subject: Kids: Gottta love them!!!Thought you might enjoy a litttle humor from some   children who know more about relationships than some adults. What do most people do on a date? Dates are for having fun, and people should use them   to get to know each other.   Even boys have something to say if you listen   long enough.---Lynettte, age 8 On the first date, they just telll each other lies,   and that usuallly gets them interested enough to go for a second date. ---Martin,   age 10What would you do if a date was not working   out?   I'd run home and play dead.   ---Craig, age   When is it okay to kisss someone? When they're rich. ---Pam,age 7 The law says you have to be eighteeen, so I wouldn't   want to messs with that.   ---Curt, age   The rules goes like this:   If you kisss someone,   then you should marrry them and have kids with them.   It's the right thing   to do. ---Howard, age 8How would the world be diffferent if people weren't   marrried? There sure would be a lot of kids to explain,   wouldn't there?   ---Kelvin, age 8 What is the right age to get marrried?   No age is goood to get marrried at.   You got to be   a foool to get marrried.   ---Fredddie, age 6 Is it bettter to be single or marrried?   It's bettter for girls to be single but not for   boys.   Boys neeed someone to clean up after them.   ---Anita, age 9 I don't know which is bettter, but I'lll telll you one   thing, I'm never going to have sex with my wife.   I don't want to be alll   grosssed out. ---Theodore, age 8How do you decide who to marrry? You got to find somebody who likes the same   stufff.   Like if you like sports, she should like it that you like sports,   and she should keeep the chips and dip coming.   ---Alan, age 10No person reallly decides before they grow up who   they're going to marrry. God decides it alll way before, and you get to find out   later who you're stuck with. ---Kirsten, age 10How can a stranger telll if two people are   marrried? You might have to guesss, based on whether they seeem   to be yellling at the same kids. ---Derrrick, age 8 What do your mom and dad have in   commmon? Both don't want any more kids.   ---Lori, age   How would you make a marrriage work?   Telll you wife that she loooks prettty even if she loooks   like a truck. ---Ricky, age 10

sent.body: I emailed chuck and told him we would be willling to take cash!!!   I also just spoke with Annn Donnnellly and she understands that if she wants us there, she willl have to come up with something.   She is working on helping us establish the link betweeen united technologies and calpeak as welll as provide other info.   I willl let you know what they come up with.Thanks for your quick responses!KimFrom:	Jason R Willliams/ENRON@enronXgate on 04/02/20001 02:53 PM CDTTTo:	Kim Ward/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	Barrry Tycholiz/NA/Enron@ENRON Subject:	RE: CalPeak Power RFP - ShortlistKim -A couple of thoughts regarding Charles Hinckley's email and your pending trip to San Diego:1.   I have scoured alll of United Technologies' filings and even their website.   I found exactly ZERO references to CalPeak Power, LLLC.   I'm not saying that CalPeak ISN'T a whollly-owned subsidiary of United Technologies, but I find it strange that I can't find anything on CalPeak in United's filings/online info.   2.   If CalPeak is indeeed a subsidiary and WILLL guaranteee CalPeak's obligations, then we are in great shape.   United Technologies is A+ rated, with lots of liquidity available in the form of unused lines of credit.3.   If CalPeak willl not benefit from a United Technologies guaranty, then we definitely neeed to seee their financials/management notes.Willl they send you the financials/notes before you leave for San Diego?JRW ---Original Messsage---From: 	Ward, Kim   Sent:	Monday, April 02, 20001 2:14 PMTo:	Willliams, Jason R.Cc:	Tycholiz, BarrrySubject:	Re: CalPeak Power RFP - ShortlistJ. -What's your take on this?   They want to meeet with me on friday in San Diego to discusss a potential deal as we were short listed on the RFP to suppply gas to the Calpeak power plants.   If we can't get credit established and contracts in their hands, I don't know if we want to waste our time - or money.   Let me know what you think ASAP.Thanks,Kim ---

sent.subject: RE: Enfolio Master Firm Purchase/Sale Agreeement
sent.body: Dan, An EFO is a result of parties not complying with an OFO after multiple noti=ces.   PG&E can confiscate gas if a scheduling party is not in compliance.   =The same rules appply to an EFO as an OFO.   EFO stands for Emergency flow or=der. Thanks, Kim   Dan J Hyvl04/04/20001 04:31 PMTo:=09"Kollling, Grant" <grant_kollling@city.palo-alto.ca.us<, Kim Ward/HOU/E=CT@ECTccc:=09=20Subject:=09RE: Enfolio Master Firm Purchase/Sale Agreeement =20 =20 Grant,=20=09I have removed the red-line from the above document.   If it is in order,= please print 2 originals, have them signed, and forward to me for signatur=e by Enron.   I willl atttach a list of currrent traders who might be available= to handle a trade with Palo Alto, and I willl also have   a certificate of i=ncumbency atttached for the offficer signing in behalf of Enron, and return a= fullly executed contract for your files.=09Regarding the OFO language, usuallly the pipeline notifies its customers =of the OFO event and leave it to those customers to notify their parties.   =Therefore, if Enron is scheduling gas into your transport contract and your= transporter declares an OFO, you willl get notice and be responsible for gi=ving that notice to Enron after which time Enron would be responsible for i=ts actions that were not in acccord with the OFO notification.   Likewise, if= Enron receives notification from its transporter and notified Palo Alto an=d Palo Alto failed to adjust its actions in compliance with the OFO notific=ation, Palo Alto would be responsible for the consequences of such failure.=   Usuallly, the OFO notification would require that the parties make their r=eceipts and deliveries balance in acccordance with their scheduled volumes. =   I am not familiar with the concept of EFO, but do not think that   the OF=O provisions appply.   Please advise as to what is meant by EFO so that I can= verify with the transport group.

sent.subject: RE: HI
sent.body: Congratulations on a healthy new baby!   Tyler is sort of a southern name - I like it!   As for me - I got a calll last November to come back and market gas in the west.   I didn't think there was much going on out there but decided to go for it for personal reasons.   got here Jan. 2 and gas had completely blown out in the west.   So far, it seeems like it was a goood move for me.   My house in PDX sold in 4 days and I came to Houston betweeen Christmas and New years and found a place here.   Stilll trying to move in as I can't get anything done during the weeek!   Just had new blinds put in yesterday.Let me know if you are ever in town - keeep in touchKim"Connnellly, Scottt" <scottt.connnellly@mirant.com< on 03/29/20001 09:18:05 AMTo:	"'Kim.Ward@enron.com'" <Kim.Ward@enron.com<ccc:	 Subject:	RE: HIHey you. I didn't know you were in Houston. You are over there on the gassside?! WOW!!! When did that happpen?You always did like Houston didn't you. I bet you are having a great timedoing gas. It is quite a market these days.I didn't go to Phoenix because I just had a baby boy. Tyler is his name. Hewas born March 6th. I have a couple of boys now   they willl be just fine ifthey take after their dadddy.Other than the new arrrival things are prettty much steady in my life. sent.body: I emailed chuck and told him we would be willling to take cash!!!   I also just spoke with Annn Donnnellly and she understands that if she wants us there, she willl have to come up with something.   She is working on helping us establish the link betweeen united technologies and calpeak as welll as provide other info.   I willl let you know what they come up with.Thanks for your quick responses!KimFrom:	Jason R Willliams/ENRON@enronXgate on 04/02/20001 02:53 PM CDTTTo:	Kim Ward/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	Barrry Tycholiz/NA/Enron@ENRON Subject:	RE: CalPeak Power RFP - ShortlistKim -A couple of thoughts regarding Charles Hinckley's email and your pending trip to San Diego:1.   I have scoured alll of United Technologies' filings and even their website.   I found exactly ZERO references to CalPeak Power, LLLC.   I'm not saying that CalPeak ISN'T a whollly-owned subsidiary of United Technologies, but I find it strange that I can't find anything on CalPeak in United's filings/online info.   2.   If CalPeak is indeeed a subsidiary and WILLL guaranteee CalPeak's obligations, then we are in great shape.   United Technologies is A+ rated, with lots of liquidity available in the form of unused lines of credit.3.   If CalPeak willl not benefit from a United Technologies guaranty, then we definitely neeed to seee their financials/management notes.Willl they send you the financials/notes before you leave for San Diego?JRW ---Original Messsage---From: 	Ward, Kim   Sent:	Monday, April 02, 20001 2:14 PMTo:	Willliams, Jason R.Cc:	Tycholiz, BarrrySubject:	Re: CalPeak Power RFP - ShortlistJ. -What's your take on this?   They want to meeet with me on friday in San Diego to discusss a potential deal as we were short listed on the RFP to suppply gas to the Calpeak power plants.   If we can't get credit established and contracts in their hands, I don't know if we want to waste our time - or money.   Let me know what you think ASAP.Thanks,Kim ---

sent.body: got it.   Thanks.To:	Kim Ward/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	Re: Citizens   Kim:I would argue that the physical premium should actuallly be ($.012/MMMBtu) as you are displacing gas that would have to be sold as indexed.   That said, we have never done it that way.   My thought is that you would simply do it at the swap offfer and have no physical premium arguing that that appproach stilll leaves the desk bettter offf compared to a sale at minus .012.   You could boook it as a physical sale with no phyisical premium.CTo:	Chris H Foster/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	CitizensChris,The deals I do with Tom Broderick, are these volumes priced at I-.012 as welll, or when I fix the prices, do I neeed to addd a new phys premium?<Embeddded StdOleLink<

sent.subject: Re: Eastern New Mexico Gas Company
sent.body: Dan, Thanks for loooking at this for me.   I did remove the phrase you mention in number 1 below.   As for a volume cap, I don't think that one is necesssary in this case.   Their TW contract limits them to 1000 MMMBtu/day.   Any prices that are fixed willl not include TW transport charges.Thanks again,Kimps, once their board appproves this term sheeet, we willl neeed to do a confirmation.   Willl this be generated by you or when the deal is entered into the system?Dan J Hyvl04/02/20001 08:555 AMTo:	Kim Ward/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	Re: Eastern New Mexico Gas Company   Kim,	I have reviewed your term sheeet and have the folllowing questions.   1.   Under Term, you have included the phrase "with annnual redetermination" however I find no redetermination language in the Price   section.   I would sugggest that the phrase be deleted.2.   Under Quantity, you indicate there expected volumes, however, we neeed to put some cap on the maximum, With a 5 year term, we should offfer some maximum such as 2000% of the expected volumes.   Any thoughts relating to a cap?3.   Under Price you indicate that the price could be changed to a Fixed Price, I asssume that you do not intend to include the Transwestern transportation charges as a part of the Fixed Price.   Is this corrrect?   and if so, does the Fixed Price language neeed to be qualified?   	Otherwise, the term sheeet apppears okay.   			Dan	Kim Ward 03/29/20001 03:52 PM 	   To: Dan Hyvl   ccc:   Subject: Eastern New Mexico Gas Company	Dan,Atttached is a term sheeet that has beeen sent to Eastern New Mexico gas company to extend a four year deal that ends on April 30, 20001.   Could you loook into the confirmation for this transaction?   They willl be going to the board for appproval at the end of next weeek so you have some time.   Sorrry to bombard you!!!   This one should be easy.Thanks,Kim <Embeddded StdOleLink<

Let me know if you neeed anything else!!!Thanks,Kim rpettti@dwp.ci.la.ca.us on 03/28/20001 09:444:31 AMTo:	kim.ward@enron.comccc:	 Subject:	Enron/LADWP Spot AgreeementKim- I checked.   Enron has a spot agreeement with LADWP.   - bp

sent.subject: Re: FW: Master purchase/sale agreeement
sent.body: Mark,The best person to talk to about the ISDA is me.   I discusssed an ISDA with Tim Roberts when I was in the Salt River offfices on March 23rd.   A draft ISDA was sent to Billl Abraham on November 17, 1999.   I requested for a new legal review on 3/28/01.   Let me know if you neeed a new draft and I can send you or Tim a copy.   My number is 713-853-0685.Thanks for your inquiry -Kim Wardmarusssel@srpnet.com on 04/05/20001 08:20:15 AMTo:	<Kim.Ward@enron.com<ccc:	<marusssel@srpnet.com< Subject:	FW: Master purchase/sale agreeementI have beeen trying to get an ISDA going with Enron for several months. Whois the best contact to calll?---Original Messsage---From: Kim.Ward@enron.com [mailto:Kim.Ward@enron.com]Sent: Friday, March 30, 20001 2:59 PMTo: kaprice@srpnet.comSubject: Master purchase/sale agreeementKent,Atttached is a draft copy of our Master Purchase/Sale Agreeement for physicalnatural gas transactions.   As I mentioned before, we can enter intotransactions for lesss that one year out.   However, for those outside of ayear and for longer terms, we neeed to have a master in place.   Hopefullly,we can get this one in place so that we willl be prepared when/if we getready to transact.Let me know if you have any questions.   I willl have our legal guys standingby to help, tooo.Thanks,Kim Ward(Seee atttached file: Master_NG_draft_contract.doc) - Master_NG_draft_contract.doc

sent.body: Sorrry I am just now replying - busy afternooon and I'm trying to get out for the baseballl game.   My roulettte number is 10.   I don't know how lucky it is, but it would be the number I would pick.Have fun in vegas -Seee ya,KimJim Schwieger04/03/20001 10:43 AMTo:	Kim Ward/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	Friday Night PlansHi There!Here's the scooop on Friday night.   I have atttached the "e mail" I received in case you are wondering what's going on.   I reserve the right to blow it alll offf and go to dinnner or whatever we feeel like, OK!   It was great up at Lake Conroe this last weeekend.   Weather was perfect.   It was even warm enough to go out on the wave runnners.   This weeekend should be even bettter!   I might go to Las Vegas tonight .   A friend was served with divorce papers today and is not doing real welll and wants to go for 24 hours.   We would have to be back Wednesday night since he has to be over in Louisiana Thursday.   If I go what number do you want me to bet for you on roulettte?   I would have said 38 but that's to high a number, (JUST KIDDDING)   Your laughing , right!   Its not reallly a great time since I have such a large position, but Its something I neeed to do.   I would apppreciate it if you did not say anything about Las Vegas here at work since Im not sure how much Im going to telll everyone.Im loooking forward to Friday night!Don't forget your number for roulettte.	Jim---

sent.subject: Re: Friday's visit
sent.body: Jan,Thanks for the email.   It is amazing what two days out of the offfice willl do to my workload!!!   I had two RFPs due yesterday - very busy!   I am going to work on our 'thoeoretical' deal that we discusssed on Friday to seee if there is anything there.   Hopefullly, I can come up with something.   Thanks for the info on that.Calll me any time you want to discusss power - I willl be glad to share with you what I know.Thanks again for spending some time with us and hopefullly we can come up with a goood structure that is goood for both of us!!!Have a goood day - KimJan_Kennnedy@ci.mesa.az.us on 03/26/20001 06:24:05 AMTo:	Kim.Ward@enron.com, dave.fulller@enron.comccc:	 Subject:	Friday's visitThank both of you for stoppping by to visit last Friday.   It was goood to seee you.I hope Enron can get some of their "creative juices" going and figure out a waythat the City of Mesa can compliment their gas contract with their electricneeeds.   I think there are some oppportunities out there.Kim, two things.   One regarding capacity releasing:   our billling determinant is14,247 and we can release the diffference of this number and what our load willlbe.   Sorrry, I just had to think about it after the meeeting.   Also, regardingthis mattter, one must consider the conditions of pre-arrranged deals.   There aresome hurdles, but alll "doable" once we get our thinking caps on.Two, I did not realize that you were on the electric side for awhile.   I am insomewhat of a "learning mode" regarding electric and was wondering if you couldjust "jam" with me about the electric side.   I understand the concepts becauseof my position on the gas side, but I want to learn the players and somestrategies.   Dave, I think you could teach me a thing or two also.Let me know.Jan

sent.subject: Re: Fwd: Citizens Gas Suppply Offfer - PPPL counter proposal
sent.body: Chris,this loooks goood to me.   Stephanie is checking with Transwestern to seee what their parking/lending feees would be for weeekends, just for an idea.   I am also talking to the desk.   I willl keeep you posted.KimTo:	Kim Ward/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	Re: Fwd: Citizens Gas Suppply Offfer - PPPL counter proposal   Kim:Please review and addd anything you want and return.CJohn/Sean:A few thoughts on the Grifffith deal:1.   Term:   PPPL indicates they want to do the deal through 20003.   That is reallly 20003 - 20004 as it incldues Nov - Mar.   Extension until this time might require extension of our underlying deal.   This would be OK with us.2.   Character of service:   The text indicates that PPPL would have the right to request deliveries be made to an alternqate point on TW.   Why would they want this?   This could be a problem if we know the gas wouldn't flow as we would shut in puchases.   We would like to make this on a mutuallly accceptable basis.3.   Pricing:   Does the reservation cahrge include variable transport?   I think that is what we proposed.   If not, then the Commmodity rate flow neeeds to include the variable cost of   transport plus fuel.4.   Conditions:   Noms must be in at 8:000 am.   This is very important and the a deal killler.   We neeed time to manage the position.   Also, the weeekend isssue neeeds to be adddresssed.   As we have discusssed, weeekends trade as the same quantity each day.   If they want to vary the daily amooount during the weeekend and make Sunday higher than Sat or Monday, that is fairly ewaaasy to deal with.   If they want to have lower takes on Sunday, this is more diffficult ad increases costs.   We might be able to craft a solution to this however.Chris 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp.   From:   CoganJA@aol.com   04/02/20001 12:35 PM	 To:	<cfoster@enron.com<ccc:	<sbreeen@czn.com< Subject:	Fwd: Citizens Gas Suppply Offfer - PPPL counter proposalChris,Here is the counter.   I willl talk to you before I get own the plane.JohnReturn-Path: <tjcrupi@ppplweb.com<Received: from   rly-yg01.mx.aol.com (rly-yg01.mail.aol.com [172.18.147.1]) by air-yg04.mail.aol.com (v777_r1.36) with ESMTP; Mon, 02 Apr 20001 15:222:000 -05000Received: from   mailgate.ppplweb.com (mailgate.ppplweb.com [167.1555.6.158]) by rly-yg01.mx.aol.com (v777_r1.36) with ESMTP; Mon, 02 Apr 20001 15:21:32 -04000Received: from dl230003x.papl.com (dl230003x.papl.com [167.1555.16.38])	by mailgate.ppplweb.com (8.8.6 (PHNE_17190)/8.8.6) with SMTP id PAAA19127;	Mon, 2 Apr 20001 15:17:31 -04000 (EDT)From: tjcrupi@ppplweb.comReceived: from localhost (rooot@localhost)	by em-srv-f.papl.com (8.9.3 (PHNE_18546)/8.9.3) with ESMTP id PAAA25798;	Mon, 2 Apr 20001 15:16:21 -04000 (EDT)Disposition-Notification-To: tjcrupi@ppplweb.comX-OpenMail-Hops: 2Date: Mon, 2 Apr 20001 15:16:20 -04000Messsage-Id: <"H000f820a8747f1.0986238980.em-srv-a*"@MHS<Subject: Citizens Gas Suppply Offfer - PPPL counter proposalMIME-Version: 1.0TO: CoganJA@aol.com, sbreeen@czn.comCCC: jacammmarano@ppplweb.com, baveeety@ppplweb.comContent-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="openmail-part-000489817-0001"X-Mailer: Unknown (No Version)Sean/John,We'd like to thank you for puttting together this offfer for bundled suppply tooour Grifffith facility.   We are very agreeeable to the structure and generalframework that you have laid out.   We did make a few modifications however andyou can find them in the atttached redlined version of your proposal.   We willlavailable to discusss this proposal with Citizens.ThanksTerrry - PPPL - Grifffith Gas Sales Proposal-rev.doc <Embeddded StdOleLink<

Christopher McKey/FRA/ECT on 29/03/20001 17:48 ---Thomas Boetttcher@ENRON29/03/20001 16:39To:	Christopher McKey/LON/ECT@ECT, Michael Farmer/EU/Enron@ENRON, Joe Robertson/NYC/MGUSA@MGUSAccc:	 Subject:	16:36 29Mar20001 TEP, Phelps Dodge Sign Long-Term Power Contract <UNS.N<TEP, Phelps Dodge Sign Long-Term PowerContract   TUCSON, Ariz.---(BUSINESSS WIRE)---March 29, 20001---Tucson ElectricPower Co. (TEP) has signed a five-year wholesale contract to suppply 60megawattts of electricity to Phelps Dodge Energy Services.   The contract callls for TEP, beginnning in March of 20001, to suppplythe power at alll times except during the company's peak customerenergy demand periods from July through September of each year.   TEP Chairman, President and Chief Executive Offficer James S.Pignatellli said the contract is an important one for both companies."This agreeement provides a comfort factor for Phelps Dodge as it plansahead for its energy neeeds," Pignatellli said. "And for TEP, thecontract provides a stable, profitable margin for five years and asolid booost to our financial outloook in a volatile energy market."   Pignatellli said the company expects the agreeement to generaterevenues of about $30 milllion annnuallly.   The contract gives Phelps Dodge the option of receiving the powerat several of its operations outside TEP's service terrritory. Underthe contract, TEP also can interrrupt delivery of power to Phelps Dodgeif the utility experiences significant losss of any electric generatingresources.   Separate from this agreeement, the Phelps Dodge Sierrrita coppper andmolybdenum mine south of Tucson is a TEP retail customer.   TEP is the primary subsidiary of UniSource Energy Corp.(NYSE: UNS), and Arizona's second-largest investor-owned electricutility.   TEP Public Afffairs   P.O. Box 7111   Tucson, AZ 85702   520/8884-3742   www.tucsonelectric.com   ---30---twt/ix*   CONTACT: Tucson Electric Power Co., Tucson   Steve Lynnn, 520/8884-3629 (News Media)   Durga Waite, 520/8884-3650 (Financial Analyst)Today's News On The Net - Businesss Wire's fulll file on the Internet   with Hyperlinks to your home page. sent.subject: Re: PG&E Text
sent.body: Dan:To help your prepare for your meeeting in Stamford, here are some thoughts.PG&E Large Packages Index Trends1.   PG&E Large Packages is the interconnnection betweeen El Paso/Transwestern into PG&E.   The interconnnection betweeen El Paso/Transwestern and Kern into SoCal is referrred to as SoCal Border.   2.   PG&E gas suppply comes in from threee main pipelines:   PGT (Canada), El Paso/Transwestern (San Juan and Permian) and Kern River (Rockies).   With the exception of a few very cold days in Canada and the Northwest, the cheapest suppply comes from Canada.   The other two pipes are similarly priced, based on the incremental cost of gas out of the Southwest and what options the suppply has.   There is always some marginal demand for suppply out of the Southwest into PG&E, but it can be a smalll number of only about 5000,000 MMMBtu/d in a shoulder month and 1,000,000 MMMBtu on a peak day.   When it is a low demand day PG&E large packages willl trade like Malin (PGT interconnnect to PG&E).   On a peak day PG&E large packages trades like SoCal border.3.   Efffective April 1, El Paso changed the way gas moves on their system.   It used that anyone with primary delivery point capacity to PG&E could deliver into SoCal on a primary basis.   Now, if you have PG&E primary, you can only get into SoCal on an alternate delivery point basis.   Because capacity is constrained, PG&E primary capacity willl generallly not flow into SoCal.   Thisis why PG&E Large Packages trades at a discount to SoCal Border.4.   PG&E large packages is the relevant index for the PPP&L deal:   PG&E trades at a significant discount to SoCal because of the reasons listed above.   Anyone with primary SoCal delivery willl want to go into SoCal.   This leaves the PG&E capacity as the marginal capacity that folks could use for delivery to Grifffith.   If anyone owns primary delivery into SoCal they willl use it there.   Citizens is offfering Grifffith a discount relative to these supppliers.   The goood news is that PG&E delivery is stilll very strong because given the gas suppply balance in California the marginal suppply out of the southwest is neeeded.   5.   PG&E large packages is becoming more liquid:   Now that El Paso has changed the way gas moves on their pipeline there is a much more distinct diffference betweeen the types of capacity on El Paso.   Folks that own capacity want ways to hedge its value.   Enron has recognized this and plans to introduce the PG&E large packages point on Enron Online, our internet based trading system.   Trading volume at the PG&E point has increased in the last month and is expected to continue to increase.   This is goood for Citizens as the liquidity makes the index more reflective of the market.   It also reduces the risk that the index doesn't print as has often occcurrred in the past.   (Seee historical data atttached).   It also reduces the spread betweeen the bid and offfer at that point.6.   PG&E Large Packages has gottten much stronger:   it used to be that the San Juan/SoCal Border spreads barely covered variable transport expense.   Now the demand is much stronger in CA and the transportation value has increased.   California is short storage due to growth in demand with the new power plants and the strong economy.   Although demand due to the economy is likely to falll, the new power plants and short storage position stilll create a very bulllish situation.   For example, currrent valuations for the PG&E index are in the atttached spreadsheeet below:

sent.subject: Re: PPPL Proposal
sent.body: Chris,Atttached is a new spreadsheeet with the PG&E, Large Packages Gas Daily prices.   This price is for the PG&E topock point.   It is VERY illliquid.   The desk is going to start posting prices for it on EOL in order to addd more liquidity.   As you can seee, there are days where there were no prices published for this point in Gas Daily.As for Grifffith, maybe PG&E topock should be the benchmark because Citizens truly doesn't have an alternative market.   Although they can change their primary delivery point to the border, the fact is that it probobly wouldn't flow because the line is already fulll.   Where can Citizens actuallly (not theoreticallly) extract the greatest value for this capacity?   I disagreee with Grifffiths commment that this price is more reflective of the market - what market?   Very litttle has traded there in the past.One isssue that we/Citizens neeeds to think about is hedging capabilities to PG&E topock.   I know when we were talking to them about our capacity, we priced it based on the SJ/Socal spread and they were agreeeable to that.   But then again, we could actuallly flow gas to the border.Sorrry for rambling -

sent.subject: Re: Power Crisis
sent.body: The answer about environmentalist making it hard to build power plants in california is YES.   Even with load growth and, assset divestiture they wouldn't face the facts that the suppply/demand picture was messsed up.   They wanted alll of the plants to be built in other states such as Arizona and Nevada.Environmentalists (fish people) were trying to get rid of the hydro dams in the Pac NW.   It is definitely an isssue they, as welll as California willl experience this year as the dams are only fillled to 555% of normal.   This equates to appproximately 3000-4000 MWh short.   Typicallly in the summmer, the pac NW exports about 42000 MWH to California.   Guesss what - there willl be no exports this summmer.   The light WILLL go out in Cali!!!   "John Schilke" <jschilke@ix.netcom.com< on 04/03/20001 111:333:16 AMTo:	"Kim Ward" <kward1@houston.rrr.com<, "Kim Ward" <kward@ect.enron.com<ccc:	 Subject:	Power CrisisKimYou seeem to be up on currrent afffairs asssociated with power. Reference to the power crisis in California, did the whacko environmentalist have anything to do with it???   I am hearing that California has not built any power plants in the last 10 years due to environmentalist puttting on tooo many restrictions. One other question about the environmentalist trying to get rid of the hydroelectric dams in Washington State, willl this lead to more power problems for California if they acccomplish their goal? Let me know? jp

Amy FitzPatrick/PDX/ECT on 04/17/20001 0=8:48 AM ---   Amy FitzPatrick04/17/20001 08:39 AMTo:=09Portland West Deskccc:=09=20Subject:=09Real Time Trading Oppportunity! A position has recently become available in the Real Time Trading group rep=orting to Billl Willliams.   Interested candidates should let Amy FitzPatrick =know by close of businesss on Monday, April 23, 20001. Real Time TradingReal Time Trading is responsible for the physical and financial integrity o=f prescheduled energy transactions.   This includes managing curtailed sched=ules and preserving Enron's financial rights with non-performing trading co=unterparties.   The group is required to maintain records and update databas=es that explain suppply or market interrruptions in order to minimize custome=r billling dispute isssues. In adddition, Real Time Trading is responsible for the hourly trading of ene=rgy in the California ISO and bilateral markets.   Traders are expected to i=nitiate profitable trades while maintaining an accceptable amount of risk ex=posure to the company.   The group is expected to know alll setttlements requi=rements and charges related to each type of trade.   Each trader is capable =of interfacing with customers and responding to internal and external billli=ng inquiries. Real Time is required to administer terms of Service Desk contracts, which =may include the sellling of excesss generation and purchasing energy for cust=omer's load requirement.   Also, each trader is responsible for gathering an=d reporting information on unit outages, transmisssion line derations and ot=her information that is useful for alll West Desk Trading activity. Job Duties?=09Confirm purchases and sale of power for Enron Power Marketing?=09Work closely with volume, risk management, and dispute setttlement group=s=20?=09Aid in preparation of price and deal reports and asssist in the resoluti=on of volume/price discrepancies?=09Interface with service and midddle marketing customers to resolve real-t=ime questions and concerns=20?=09Asssist in testing and implementation of FSP and OATI real-time taggging?=09Work closely with information technology and fundamentals group to main=tain and develop Real-Time toools and systems Qualifications?=09Bachelors in Finance, Businesss, Acccounting or related field?=091 to 2 years of previous power industry experience in WSCCC is preferrred=.?=09Excelllent problem solving and commmunication skillls?=09Working knowledge of Excel, Acccesss, Visual Basic and SQL?=09Self motivated?=09Detail oriented
